Finally in our Week of Winners, the Science Award went to @APHAgovuk's International Travel Risk Assessment team.

"This was a large and complicated project under incredible time-pressure...which we handled with good humour and perseverance."

https://t.co/6ksTOKwFPp #CSAwards

Our penultimate Week of Winners article is on the Rising Star Award winner, Abigail Agyei from @mhclg.

"I enjoy when I am able to connect, build and maintain relationships with stakeholders and groups to support communities and create change."

https://t.co/9a11Kb9CUO #CSAwards

Next in our Week of Winners, @DHSCgovuk, @DWP, @NHSX and NHS Digital won the Resilience & Rapid Response Award for the Get an Isolation Note service.

"Everyone put in a tremendous effort to focus on...rapidly delivering a practical solution."

https://t.co/QvNxGvYj8Y #CSAwards

Opening our final day of Week of Winners is the Public Service Award, won by joint @HMRCgovuk and @hmtreasury CJRS, SEISS and EOHO teams.

"I've never felt so proud to be part of such a large scale effort."

https://t.co/dfDzqeHZac #CSAwards

Lastly in today's Week of Winners, @DWP's Virtual Machine Environment-Replacement won the Project Delivery Award.

"My sense of pride has grown and grown as I have seen the collective effort colleagues have made in responding to the pandemic."

https://t.co/lqKpu6U8Nu #CSAwards

Next up in our Week of Winners: the Policy & Use of Evidence Award went to the GO-Science COVID SAGE Secretariat, @beisgovuk.

"This award is a tribute to the collective hard work that so many have dedicated to support the UK response to COVID."

https://t.co/pB2Rp6ajxX #CSAwards

For the penultimate day of Week of Winners, we start with Chris Atkinson from @NIOgov, who won the Inspirational Leadership Award.

"I've had the privilege...to do something that would make a practical difference to people's lives."

https://t.co/ZB6VvrpS6R #CSAwards

Wrapping up today's Week of Winners case studies is the Accelerated Capability Environment from the @ukhomeoffice, which won the Innovation Award.

"This award...provides an opportunity to share an effective approach to government innovation."

https://t.co/xV5R2s0ISu #CSAwards

Marking the halfway point of our Week of Winners is Gillian Whitworth from @FCDOGovUK, winner of the Health & Wellbeing Award.

"This is a really important step towards moving eating disorders up the agenda."

https://t.co/IukkreSFF0 #CSAwards

Next in our Week of Winners is @HMRCgovuk Campaigns & Projects Leeds D&I Group, Diversity & Inclusion Award winners.

"We feel proud...to be part of an organisation that understands the ever changing and evolving needs of its diverse workforce."

https://t.co/5lAud4uKAM #CSAwards

Our final Week of Winners article for today is on Get Your State Pension from @DWP, winning the Digital, Data & Technology Award.

"We all share the same goal of wanting to improve services for citizens."

https://t.co/SZNOTcwiSI #CSAwards

The Developing People Award is next in our Week of Winners, won by the Inclusion Apprenticeship Programme from @FCDOGovUK.

"Whenever you get the opportunity to help someone - do it."

https://t.co/GEH3KuvESn #CSAwards

Our fourth Week of Winners case study is on the Vehicle Tax Evasion Campaign from @DVLAgovuk, which won the Communication Award.

"So much work goes into planning and running this type of campaign, so it is great for everyone involved to win."

https://t.co/Lb4eZmBxhP #CSAwards

Next in our Week of Winners is the Complex Transactions Team from @cabinetofficeuk, winners of the Commercial Award.

"Being a civil servant means doing really important work that makes a tangible difference to the lives of citizens."

https://t.co/PNTsBWuApC #CSAwards

Next up in our Week of Winners is the Shielding team from @mhclg, who won the Collaboration Award.

"We all had our small parts to play but it added up to something incredible."

https://t.co/IzBarARlmR #CSAwards

First up in our Civil Service Awards Week of Winners is Sarah Morton from @DWP, winner of the Citizenship Award.

"The Civil Service is the backbone of our country, and I am proud to be a part of it."

https://t.co/fELfEyH5uj #CSAwards

Welcome to our Week of Winners! This week, we are celebrating all those who won their categories at the Civil Service Awards 2020, which took place at the end of last month.

Shona Dunn, Civil Service Awards Champion, opens the week. #CSAwards https://t.co/wwsp0yJ7dg

And so concludes the Civil Service Awards 2020, our first ever online awards ceremony. Thank you to everyone involved behind the scenes to make this a success, to our fabulous hosts, and to you for tuning in. We hope you enjoyed it! See you for the next one. #CSAwards https://t.co/ln1UyAwDOD

Last but certainly not least, the Science Award goes to the International Travel Risk Assessment Team in the Animal and Plant Health Agency. Very many congratulations! #CSAwards https://t.co/KTtGbI0lqH
Next up is the Rising Star Award, which goes to Abigail Agyei from the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government. A huge well done to Abigail! #CSAwards https://t.co/lmgOWT7KHP

The Isolation Note is the winner of the Resilience & Rapid Response Award, made up of teams from the Department of Health and Social Care, the Department for Work and Pensions, NHSX, and NHS Digital. Great job all! #CSAwards https://t.co/J4ZVIolVFT
Congratulations to joint CJRS, SEISS and EOHO teams from HM Treasury and HM Revenue & Customs for winning the Public Service Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/dpjBtzBKLU

The Project Delivery Excellence Award goes to the Virtual Machine Environment Replacement (Jobseeker's Allowance) from the Department for Work and Pensions. Well done team! #CSAwards https://t.co/yiM5Idl8ss

Many congratulations to GO-Science COVID SAGE Secretariat from the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, worthy winners of the Policy & Use of Evidence Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/EaW15MresF
The winner of the Inspirational Leadership Award is Chris Atkinson from the Northern Ireland Office - a round of applause for Chris! #CSAwards https://t.co/LnF97f3GGG
Outstanding work from the Accelerated Capability Environment in the Home Office, winners of the Innovation Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/6YgUPIS12h
Our next winner is Gillian Whitworth from the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office - well done Gillian for winning the Health & Wellbeing Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/2gnhIOV63y
The Diversity & Inclusion Award goes to the D&I Group at Campaigns & Projects, Leeds. Many congratulations to the team! #CSAwards https://t.co/JsHwaICZMS
Next up, the Department for Work and Pensions wins the Digital, Data & Technology Award for their work on Get Your State Pension. Fantastic work! #CSAwards https://t.co/gIPgK1iLo9
A huge round of applause for the Inclusion Apprenticeship Programme from the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office for winning the Developing People Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/Rj9QP3g8t1
Three cheers for the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency’s Vehicle Tax Evasion Campaign 2020, winners of the Communication Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/5O3RMXCAV9
The Commercial Award goes to the Complex Transactions Team COVID-19 Response in the Cabinet Office - great job team! #CSAwards https://t.co/queBhX1RRf
A huge well done to the Shielding Team in the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government for winning the Collaboration Award! #CSAwards https://t.co/LNCgzdqkZ7
Our first winner this afternoon is Sarah Morton from the Department for Work and Pensions, winner of the Citizenship Award! Congratulations Sarah. #CSAwards https://t.co/e7jt1kwYiA
We are live! Welcome to the 15th Civil Service Awards, and good luck to all our shortlisted nominees! #CSAwards https://t.co/ck9acRfs66

There is less than one hour to go until the Civil Service Awards, so please take your seats for an afternoon of inspiration and celebration. We’ll see you there!
